children: Calcium homeostasis. Neutral flux of calcium between bone and blood in adults is coordinated by parathyroid hormone (PTH). Whereas most calcium filtered into urine is reabsorbed independent of PTH, PTH further increases retention of calcium from the urine. PTH indirectly augments calcium absorption in the gut by increasing production of 1,25 (OH)

vitamin D. Both effects of PTH are increasingly important at lower intakes of calcium and as blood levels of calcium decline. The amounts of calcium shown here illustrate the relative contribution of each organ to calcium homeostasis in a healthy adult.
